BBEX3.M.ERN.USD.CA.AC.A01: Exchange rates for the US dollar in Eritrea / USD 1 = ERN ... (middle)

General: With effect from 8 November 1997, Eritrea ended its currency union with Ethiopia and adopted the nakfa as its own currency. The changeover from birr to nakfa took place between 8 and 28 November 1997 at the rate of 1:1. During this period the exchange rate to the US dollar was USD 1 = ERN 7.20. The exchange rates for November 1997 to March 1999 were calculated on the basis of the buying and selling rates reported to us. From April 1999, only mid-market rates were reported. From December 2000, the exchange rates were once more calculated on the basis of buying and selling rates.
Comment on 1999-11: On 15 November 1999, the nakfa was devalued by 15.5%.

Comment on 2001-09: On 10 September 2001, the nakfa was devalued. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling rate).  7 September 2001: USD 1 = ERN 10.20 / 10.30  10 September 2001: USD 1 = ERN 13,55 / 13,80.  Calculated devaluation: 25.0% (middle rate).
